text: Eugenia caryophyllus ( clove ) showed the highest ferric reducing capacity in terms of Trolox ® concentrations , such as in the DPPH method , in contrast to the TBARS method , in which Thymus vulgaris showed to be more effective [ 52 ] . According to the same authors , a significant linear correlation between FRAP values and total phenolic contents of the essential oils analysed were observed , except for the Thymus vulgaris essential oil .
